Example: they/buy a new house/two weeks ago

Yes,they have already bought a new house. When did they buy a new house?
They bought a new house two weeks ago.
VoaStructureExercise.desc_EN: Write questions and answers.

VoaStructureExercise.note: the boss/leave/ten minutes ago
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has the boss left yet?  Yes, the boss has already left. When did the boss leave?  He left ten minutes ago.

VoaStructureExercise.note: he/have breakfast/an half past seven
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has he had breakfast yet?  Yes, he has already had breakfast. When did he have breakfast?  He had breakfast at half past seven.

VoaStructureExercise.note: she/find her pen/an hour ago
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has she found her pen yet?  Yes, she has already found her pen. When did she find her pen?  She found her pen an hour ago.

VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has he got a television yet?  Yes, he has already got a television. When did he get a television?  He got a television two weeks ago.

VoaStructureExercise.note: she/hear the news/yesterday
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has she heard the news yet?  Yes, she has already heard the news. When did she hear the news?  She heard the news yesterday.

VoaStructureExercise.note: she/make the bed/this morning
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has she made the bed yet?  Yes, she has already made the bed. When did she make the bed?  She made the bed this morning.

VoaStructureExercise.note: he/send the letter/the day before yesterday
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has he sent the letter yet?  Yes, he has already sent the letter. When did he send the letter?  He sent the letter the day before yesterday.

VoaStructureExercise.note: she/sweep the floor/yesterday morning
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has she swept the floor yet?  Yes, she has already swept the floor. When did she sweep the floor?  She swept the floor yesterday morning.

VoaStructureExercise.note: she/tell him the truth/last night
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Has she told him the truth yet?  Yes, she has already told him the truth. When did she tell him the truth?  She told him the truth last night.

VoaStructureExercise.note: Where was Dan's bicycle picked up?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Dan's bicycle was picked up in a small village four hundred miles away.

VoaStructureExercise.note: Where is the bicycle being sent?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The bicycle is being sent to Dan's home.

VoaStructureExercise.note: What did Dan feel when he heard the news?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Dan was surprised and amused when he heard the news.

VoaStructureExercise.note: Why was Dan amused?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Dan was amused because he never expected the bicycle tobe found.

VoaStructureExercise.note: How lng ago was the bicycle stolen?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The bicycle was stolen twenty years ago.

VoaStructureExercise.answer: In spite of the fact that fares have increased, the railway company is still losing money because the employees have demanded higher wages.

VoaStructureExercise.answer: After making sure that the alarm clock worked, I set it so that it would ring at six o'clock.

VoaStructureExercise.note: I hid the Christmas presents under the desk quickly.My young daughter would not see them.She entered the room.(+++so that###when+++)
VoaStructureExercise.answer: I hid the Christmas presents under the desk quickly so that my young daughter would not see them when she entered the room.

VoaStructureExercise.answer: Refusing the offer, I explained that I had already been offered a job by another company.

VoaStructureExercise.answer: He fought the wolves off for three hours before help arrived.

VoaStructureExercise.desc_CH: 设想一下你正在为报纸写一篇有关探长和嫌疑犯对话的报道。回答以下问题，必要时可用括号内的短语：
VoaStructureExercise.desc_EN: Imagine that you are writing a newspaper report of the conversation that took place between the man and the inspector.Answer these questions on the passage.Where necessary,use the words given in parentheses:

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 3+++ What did the inspector ask him?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The inspector asked him if he always caught such an early train.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 4-5+++ Did the man say that he did or that he didn't?At what time did he have to be at work?(+++because+++)What would his employer confirm?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The man said that he did because he had to be at work at ten o'clock, and that his employer would confirm that he was there on time.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 6-7+++ What did the inspector ask him then?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The inspector then asked him if a later train would get him to work on time.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 8+++ What did the man suppose?Did he ever catch a later train?(+++but+++)
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The man supposed that it would, but said that he never caught a later train.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 9+++ What did the inspector ask?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The inspector asked at what time he had arrived at the station.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 10+++ At what time did the man say he had arrived at the station?What did he do there?(+++He added that he###+++)
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The man said that he had arrived at the station at ten to eight. He added that he had bought a paper and waited for the train.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 11-12+++ What did the inspector ask him?Did the man say that he had or that he hadn't?(+++When the inspector asked him###the man###+++)
VoaStructureExercise.answer: When the inspector asked him if he had noticed anything unusual, the man said he hadn't.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 13+++ What did the inspector suggest?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The inspector suggested that he was not telling the truth and that he did not catch the eight o'clock train, but (caught) the eight twenty-five, which would still get him to work on time.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 13-16+++ What did the inspector point out?
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The inspector pointed out that on the morning of the murder, the eight o'clock train did not run at all, as it had broken down at Ferngreen station and had been taken off the line.

VoaStructureExercise.note: At the time the murder was committed, the man said that he was travellling on the 8 o'clock train to London. The inspector asked if he always caught such an early train. The man answered that he did. He had to be at work at 10 o'clock. His employer would confirm that he was there on time. Then the inspector asked him if a later train would get him to work on time. The man supposed that a later train would get him to work on time but he never caught a later train. The inspector asked him what time he arrived at the station. The man said that he had arrived there at ten to eight. He added that he bought a paper and waited for the train. When the inspector asked him if he had noticed anything unusual, the man said that he had not.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 4-7+++ When she asked what... and how... the Ambassador answered drily that a fire extinguisher had been responsible. He then told her that...
VoaStructureExercise.answer: When she asked what had happened and how his clothes had got into such a mess, the Ambassador answered drily that a fire extinguisher had been responsible. He then told her that university students had set the Embassy on fire that morning.
VoaStructureExercise.desc_CH: 假设你正为报社写一篇关于大使和他夫人对话的报道，用以下笔录写出这篇短文：
VoaStructureExercise.desc_EN: Imagine that you are writing a newspaper report of the conversation that took place between the Ambassador and his wife.Write the passage again using the notes given below:

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 8-9+++ His wife was most surprised and asked him where...
VoaStructureExercise.answer: His wife was most surprised and asked him where he had been at the time.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines10-11+++ The Ambassador answered that he... When the fire broke out... he... Omit:‘of course'.
VoaStructureExercise.answer:
The Ambassador answered that he had been in his office as usual. When 
the fire broke out in the basement, he had gone down to investigate and a
 man called Horst had aimed a fire extinguisher at him.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 11-12+++ Horst thought the Ambassador... The Ambassador said that he must...
VoaStructureExercise.answer: Horst thought the Ambassador was on fire. The Ambassador said that he must definitely get the fellow posted.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 13-14+++ ...big hole in her husband's hat and asked him how...
VoaStructureExercise.answer: His wife suddenly noticed a big hole in her husband's hat and asked him how he could explain it.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Line 16+++ Omit:‘Oh,that,' The Ambassador said that someone had...
VoaStructureExercise.answer: The Ambassador said that someone had fired a shot through his office window.

VoaStructureExercise.note: +++Lines 16-18+++ The shot was accurate, but fortunately he had not been wearing his hat at the time. If he...
VoaStructureExercise.answer:
The shot was accurate, but fortunately he had not been wearing his hat 
at the time. If he had, he would not have been able to get home for 
lunch.

VoaStructureExercise.note: ‘We just ____(receive) a report'____(say) the radio announcer,‘that rioting ____(break) out in Umgolia.Students,who ____(demonstrate) outside the Escalopian E mbassy during the day,____(break) into the building last night and ____(set) it on fire.The students ____(protest) against the new tax in beer mugs which recently ____(inpose) by the Escalopian government.A spokensman ____(say) that the beer mug industry in Umgolia seriously ____(affect).The Escalopian Ambassador,who ____(say) to have been slightly injured,bravely ____(defent) by his servant,Mr.Flugel Horst.Mr.Horst ____(keep) off the students with a fire extinguisher.The Premier of Umgolia ____(announce) this evening that,in future,steps ____(take) to prevent further incidents.'
VoaStructureExercise.answer: have just received###said###has broken###were demonstrating/ demonstrated###broke###set###were protesting###has recently been imposed / was recently imposed###said###has been seriously affected###is said###was bravely defended###kept###announced###would be taken
